Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the World Health Organization has designated the Russian Covid-19 vaccine as the official inoculation against the coronavirus, which is not true.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the WHO has not designated any Covid-19 vaccine and clearly states on its website that there is no current vaccine.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the designation of the Russian vaccine by the WHO.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the Russian vaccine has been officially designated by the WHO without any evidence to support this.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the Russian Direct Investment Fund has applied to the WHO for the emergency use listing of its vaccine, but the registration had not been granted as of November 11.
